title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 70.5 - Answer to petition; time for answer; contents of answer; service and filing of answer; filing transcript of records
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 70.5 - Answer to petition; time for answer; contents of answer; service and filing of answer; filing transcript of records

State Regulations
(a) The Commissioner of Labor shall, within
eight days after receipt of the petition, file with the board an answer to the
petition, and a certified transcript of the record as provided by subdivision 2
of section 657 or 676, as the case may be. (b) The answer shall contain a denial or an
explanation of the material facts which are deemed relevant to the issues
raised by the petitioner. (c) The

Commissioner of Labor shall serve by mail, or by any other method permitted by
the Board including but not limited to electronically, one copy of the answer
upon each petitioner, or the attorney or authorized representative of record, and shall file the original with the Board with proof of such
service. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12

70.5

New

York State Register March 30, 2022/Volume XLIV, Issue 13, eff. 3/30/2022

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
